title: User actions
description: Let users know what they should do next in order to get the most our of the application.
text: Keep your wallet and bitcoin secure

Enable face detection or set a 
pin for extra security.

title: Unique features
description: Highlight unique features that users should know about.
text: Your recovery phrase will be encrypted and backed up to your cloud provider, only you will be able to access it.

title: Product benefits
description: Explain the main purpose of the application.
text:
Have full control with this self-custody wallet. No one else can access 
your bitcoin.

Your keys, your coins

title: Backup successful
description: A final confirmation that the backup has been completed.
text:
You should now have your recovery phrase and password written down for 
future reference.

title: Password input
description: The user chooses a password for their wallet.
text: Please write this down on paper as well.

title: Password intro
description: A short primer about the purpose of the password.
text: Now let's set a password for your wallet. This password and your recovery phrase are used to generate your wallet address. Make sure to keep this password safe as well.

title: Validation, complete
description: The user has tapped the words in the correct order and may continue.
text: Perfect. Make sure to securely store your recovery phrase.

title: Validation, progress
description: Direct feedback is provided when tapping the words.
text: Sorry, that’s not the correct third word. Give it another try.

title: Validation, start
description: The words are shown in scrambled order and the user is asked to tap them in the correct one.
text:
Tap the words in the 
correct order.

title: Validation intro
description: Introduces the verification process.
text: Well done. Now let’s verify that you've written down your recovery phrase correctly. Yes, it’s that important.

title: Copy
description: The user is asked to write down the backup phrase.
text: Make sure to write it down as shown here. You have to verify this later.

title: Intro
description: Explains the purpose and benefit of cloud backups.
text:
First, let's create your 
recovery phrase
A recovery phrase is a series of 12 words in a specific order. This word combination is unique to your wallet. Make sure to have pen and paper ready so you can write it down.

title: Product benefits
description: Explain the main purpose of the application.
text:
Take full control with this completely self-custodied wallet.

Your keys, your coins.

title: Unique features
description: Highlight unique features that users should know about.
text: Your recovery phrase will be encrypted and backed up to your cloud provider, only you will be able to access it.

title: User actions
description: Let users know what they should do next in order to get the most our of the application.
text: Keep your wallet and bitcoin secure

Enable face detection or set a 
pin for extra security.

title: Routing error
description: To prevent user concerns, error messages should clearly state the problem, provide assurance, and suggest solutions.
text:
The transaction could 
not be completed.

A connection to the receiver could 
not be made. The funds remain in 
your wallet.

This can be addressed by opening a direct payment channel, which incurs a minimum fee of 2 000 sats.

title: General error
description: When no solutions can be identified, error messages should provide alternative means for users to get help.
text:
The transaction could 
not be completed.

Sorry, the problem could not be identified. Your funds remain 
securely in your wallet.

A few things to try
Ensure your Internet connection is stable
Ask for support in our Telegram channel
If this problem persists, opening additional payment channels may help. Learn more

title: Technical details
description: Error codes and other output should be easily shareable to faciliate finding solutions.
text:
If you are stuck with this error, the information below is safe to share 
in our Telegram channel.

title: List
description: Well-organized contact lists provide useful overviews and simplify sending and receiving flows.

title: Personal contact
description: Personal contacts can gather transaction and address information.

title: Company contact
description: Company contacts can be emphasize options like scheduled payments and invoice generation.

title: Security checklist
description: A quick, actionable summary of how well the wallet is secured. Covers app security, key scheme, and backup.
text: You enabled PIN entry to access the app.
You are using a 2-2 multi-key configuration for storing medium amounts of bitcoin.

title: Inadequate security
description: A wallet can recommend users to switch to a secure setup if the amount of funds is beyond the applications security model.
text:
The security of this wallet is not adequate for the amount of funds you store. An upgrade is recommended.
Learn more
You enabled PIN entry to access the app.
You are using the default single-key setup.

title: Face ID
description: Enabling face detection could be offered during onboarding, and accessed later in settings.
text: Enable face detection for extra security
Allows you to quickly access your wallet with a quick glance at your phone. Also used as an additional security check for approving transactions.

title: Settings
description: Settings are logically grouped to provide easy entry points.

title: General
description: Basic settings for localization and notifications.

title: Privacy & security
description: PIN, FaceID, an option to hide sensitive data from display, and wallet limits.
text: Choose a PIN to access the app and protect your data.
Use FaceID to perform spending actions securely.
Hides balance and transaction amounts from display.
The maximum size of a single transaction.
The total amount that can be spent per day.

title: Wallet backup
description: Automatic and manual backup options.

title: Local currency
description: The local currency should be automatically identified, with an option to change it.

title: Help & support
description: Various ways for users to learn about the application and find support information.

title: Bitcoin unit
description: Unit settings are kept to the two most common options, bitcoin and satoshis.
text: Toggle between units on the home screen by tapping your balance.

title: Advanced
description: Connection settings for both the Bitcoin and Network settings, as well as overall data exchange.

title: Bitcoin network
description: Configuration options to connect via a personal node.

title: Privacy checklist
description: A quick, actionable summary of how the wallet privacy. Covers app privacy, data privacy
text: Balances and transactions are visible by default.
Transactions are validated with your own Bitcoin node.

title: Receive transaction, ID details
description: Even more details and options to interact with each piece of information can be accessed by tapping each row.
text: ba6f fe4f ac2b 9651 6738 73ef ab13 04cb 74d3 7ed8 851d e49b d974 ce1e 02a1 4ec7

title: Send transaction, expanded
description: The same Lightning payment with expanded details.

title: Receive transaction, expanded
description: Details can be expanded for extra information. Also shown here is a status display.
text:
Web design work for ACME Inc.
Invoice BDC01

title: Send transaction
description: Variation of the transaction screen showing a Lightning payment.

title: Budgeting
description: This overview provides better insight for budgeting and accounting purposes.

title: Activity, search & export
description: The search icons lets users access this screen for filtering and exporting activity.
text:
Web design work for ACME Inc.
Invoice BDC01

title: Activity, tips
description: Pinned entries can be used for various purposes, like incentivizing users to organize their activity.

title: Micropayments, grouped
description: Micropayments can be grouped together to clean up the list.
text:
Web design work for ACME Inc.
Invoice BDC01

title: Activity
description: Default transaction information is not helpful in understanding the payment purpose.

title: Non-payment activity
description: Activity can also include user actions related to unique features of the wallet.
text:
Web design work for ACME Inc.
Invoice BDC01

title: Annotated activity
description: Users should be able to enrich transactions with userful information like sender/receiver, purpose and categories/tags.
text:
Web design work for ACME Inc.
Invoice BDC01

title: Receive transaction
description: The transaction screen should focus on highlighting the most relevant information and options to the user. Adding Contact info, notes and tags are easily accessible.

title: Responsibility disclaimer
description: Ensure the user understands that they are in control and responsible. This is pre-text for the following screens.
text:
With bitcoin, you are your own bank. No on else has access to 
your private keys.
If you lose access to this app, and the backup we will help you create, your bitcoin cannot be recovered.

title: Cover
description: The initial cover screen provides a simple introduction to the application.
text: A simple bitcoin wallet for your enjoyment.

Your wallet, your coins
100% open-source & open-design

title: App store listing
description: The app store listing should provide a clear overview of the application purpose and benefits.
text: A simple bitcoin wallet for your daily spending needs.

title: Cloud backup options
description: Enable wallet backup.
text:
Back up your wallet 
to cloud storage
Reguarly saves an encrypted copy of your wallet to your cloud account. Allows for easy recovery in case you lose access to this device.

title: Security setup
description: Enable authentication for app access and transactions.
text: Enable PIN or Face ID to ensure only you can access the wallet and transact with your funds.

title: Initial deposit received
description: On the first deposit, the user is shown a modal with details. Fees for opening a lightning channel were incurred, and the send limit was bumped.

title: Funding options
description: Let user choose to deposit or purchase.
text: Deposit or buy bitcoin to get started.

title: Initial deposit swap fee
description: To let users better understand fees, explanations can be easily accessed.
text:
This fee is for swapping funds between networks. This automated service simplifies payments from and to many different wallets.
More about fees

title: Initial deposit address
description: The user choose to deposit bitcoin they already have (both on-chain or lightning are supported).

title: Security and privacy reminder
description: After the first deposit, the user is asked to backup their wallet and adjust security settings, if they haven’t done so yet.
text: To better protect your funds, review your backup and  security settings.
To recover your wallet in case you lose access to this application.
Set a 4-digit code to protect from unwanted access.
Require detection of your face for wallet access.

title: Receiving initial deposit
description: The user can now freely use the app. Incoming deposits are detected right away.

title: Inline backup reminder
description: We may need to remind the user to adjust their settings for appropriate security.
text:
Back up your wallet in case 
you lose access.

title: PIN choice
description: Enable authentication for app access and transactions.
text: PIN entry will be required for wallet access and transactions. Write it down as it cannot be recovered.

title: Existing user, PIN entry
description: If the app is protected by a PIN, it can also navigate there directly for existing users.
text: Enter your PIN to log in

title: Existing user
description: The user already has an account and has the option to log in or reset the wallet.
text:
Your wallet, your coins
100% open-source & open-design

title: Existing user, PIN entry, scrambled
description: Scrambling the keypad numbers can prevent attacks since the exact input is harder to observe.
text: Enter your PIN to log in

title: Confirmation
description: Final confirmation that the backup was successful.
text: If you lose this device, you can recover your encrypted wallet backup from iCloud.

title: Cloud service provider login
description: Cloud storage often have custom login and permission flows to allow the app to read and store data.
text: Cloud provider UI for accepting required permissions.

title: Service
description: Platform-specific options for cloud storage.
text: Which service do you want to use for a cloud backup?
This will back up your seed phrase with your preferred cloud storage provider.

title: PIN entry
description: A PIN is required for encrypting the stored data to prevent third-party access.
text: Use a PIN you will remember. It cannot be recovered.
This is used to encrypt your wallet, which prevents your cloud service provider from accessing it.

title: Intro
description: Explains the purpose and benefit of cloud backups.
text: Back up your wallet to iCloud or Google Drive
Don’t lose your wallet. Save an encrypted copy to your cloud service.

title: Information
description: Provide users with background information on how their data is stored.
text: This security model is great for storing small amounts for daily spending. It provides a high level of convenience with appropriate security.
The keys to your wallet are encrypted and store with your cloud storage provider (Apple iCloud or Google Drive).
Encryption prevents your storage provider from accessing your keys.
Encryption requires you to create a 4-digit PIN. You have to remember this in order to access your keys.
This security model is appropriate for amounts similar to what you are comfortable carrying with you in cash.

title: Password entry
description: As an alternative to a PIN, you may also require users to enter a password.
text: Please use a password you will remember. It cannot be recovered.
This is used to encrypt your wallet. This prevents your cloud service provider from accessing it.

title: Password manager
description: PIN and passwords could be saved to a local password manager.
text: Please use a password you will remember. It cannot be recovered.
This is used to encrypt your wallet. This prevents your cloud service provider from accessing it.
Would you like to save this password in your iCloud Keychain to use with apps and websites on all your devices?
You can view and remove saved passwords in Passwords & Accounts settings.

title: Home screen
description: Payment flows can be entered from the home screen in multiple ways - entering an amount, contacts, and scanning a QR code.

title: Home screen input
description: In this scenario, the user enters an amount and hits pay. Next, they will choose a recipient from contacts or enter an address.

title: Empty send screen
description: If the user has not entered an amount on the home screen, tapping “Pay” leads them to a blank send form.

title: Contacts
description: The contact list to choose a recipient from for initiating a transaction.

title: Partially filled send screen
description: The use has entered an amount and chosen a recipient to make a lightning payment to.

title: Completed send screen
description: In addition to the basic information, the user has also entered a description and added tags.

title: Confirm send
description: Before sending, the user confirms the payment one more time.

title: Confirm fees
description: For onchain transactions, users can also choose the urgency. The less urgent, the lower the fee.

title: Processing
description: The transaction is being sent. For lightning, this should be a very short time until completion.

title: Processing delay
description: The interface updates users if transaction processing takes longer than expected.
text: This is taking a little longer...

You will receive a notification when 
the transaction is complete.

title: Onchain processing
description: An onchain transaction takes ~10 minutes to receive a first confirmation.

title: Activity status
description: Status is also indicated in the activity screen. Users are not stuck on the transaction details screen while sending.

title: Send confirmation
description: Once complete, the user sees a send confirmation and any details relevant to the transaction (like a payment receipt).

title: Home amount input
description: Basic amount input with the option of entering via the local currency. This requires the application to know the current exchange rate.
text:
Back up your wallet in case 
you lose access.

title: Combined payment request
description: The QR code includes both an onchain address and a lighting invoice. Users can swipe left and right to navigate the details and options screens (indicated by the dots).

title: Lightning payment request
description: A lightning payment request with an amount that requires a new channel to be opened.
text:
Keep the app open until the 
payment is received.

title: Payment request details
description: Users can configure basic payment request details here.

title: Payment request detail variation
description: A completed detail screen for a lightning transaction that requires a new channel to be opened.
text: The amount exceeds your receive limit. A fee of ~2,000 sats fee will be charged to increase this limit.

title: Payment request options
description: Additional options for payment requests for specific scenarios.

title: Payment info copy feedback
description: Visual feedback is provided (also for screen readers for improved accessibility) when copying the payment information.

title: On-chain payment request options
description: For on-chain requests, it may be helpful to allow users to choose an address type, especially during standards transition periods.
text: Different address types can help you work around compatibility issues with other wallets.
Not widely supported. More private with lower fees.

title: Home
description: If the user has no funds, a custom message can inform them how to get started.
text:
Back up your wallet in case 
you lose access.

title: Backup reminder
description: Backup, security and privacy reminders can be shown on the home screen as appropriate.
text:
Back up your wallet in case 
you lose access.

title: Transaction notification
description: Pending incoming transactions are indicated via a small element above the amount input.
text:
Back up your wallet in case 
you lose access.

title: Local currency display
description: Users can tap the amounts to toggle between bitcoin and fiat units.
text:
Back up your wallet in case 
you lose access.

title: Clipboard modal
description: When the user opens the application and has data on the clipboard, it is evaluated and appropriate options are shown.
text:
Back up your wallet in case 
you lose access.

You have a Lightning address 
on your clipboard.

title: Wallet switcher
description: If the application supports multiple wallets, a switcher could be introduced via a modal, accessed via a button in the top-left corner.
text:
Back up your wallet in case 
you lose access.
